div.div: ἀ-ά̄ᾱτος (ἀϝάω): of doubtful meaning. —(1) inviolable (if α privative), νυν μοι ὄμοσσον ἀά̄ᾱτον Στυγὸς ὕ̄δωρ, Il. 14.271; cf. Στυγὸς ὕ̄δωρ, ὅς τε μέγιστος | ὅρκος δεινότατός τε πέλει μακάρεσσι θεοῖσιν, Il. 15.37 f.—(2) baleful (if α copulative), or mad, of the suitors' contest with the bow, Od. 21.81 (echoed by Odysseus, Od. 22.5). —Signif. (2) may be assumed in Il. 14 instead of (1), representing the Styx as baleful to him who swears falsely in its name.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
